title: Analysis: Descriptive Statistics
code: master <- if (file.exists("qes_master.csv")) {   read.csv("qes_master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) } else {   get_qes_master(assign_global = FALSE, strict = FALSE, quiet = TRUE) }  master <- master %>%   mutate(     qes_year_num = suppressWarnings(as.integer(sub("^([0-9]{4}).*$", "\\1", qes_year))),     age_group = trimws(as.character(age_group)),     education = trimws(as.character(education)),     turnout = tolower(trimws(as.character(turnout)))   )

title: Analysis: Descriptive Statistics
text: Sample sizes merged dataset
code: sample_sizes <- master %>%   group_by(qes_year, qes_code, qes_name_en) %>%   summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%   arrange(qes_year, qes_code)  knitr::kable(   sample_sizes,   caption = "Sample sizes in the merged dataset" )

title: Analysis: Descriptive Statistics
text: Age-group distribution (top rows)
code: age_table <- master %>%   filter(!is.na(qes_year_num), !is.na(age_group), nzchar(age_group)) %>%   group_by(qes_year_num, age_group) %>%   summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop_last") %>%   mutate(pct = 100 * n / sum(n)) %>%   ungroup() %>%   arrange(qes_year_num, desc(pct))  knitr::kable(   head(age_table, 24),   digits = 1,   caption = "Age-group distribution (top rows)" )

title: Analysis: Descriptive Statistics
code: ggplot(age_table, aes(x = qes_year_num, y = pct, color = age_group, group = age_group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.9) +   geom_point(size = 1.6) +   labs(     title = "Age-group composition across study years",     x = "Study year",     y = "Percent of respondents",     color = "Age group"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Analysis: Descriptive Statistics
code: turnout_year <- master %>%   filter(!is.na(qes_year_num)) %>%   mutate(turnout_bin = case_when(     turnout %in% c("1", "yes", "voted", "certain to vote", "i already voted") ~ 1,     turnout %in% c("0", "2", "no", "did not vote", "certain not to vote") ~ 0,     TRUE ~ NA_real_   )) %>%   filter(!is.na(turnout_bin)) %>%   group_by(qes_year_num) %>%   summarise(turnout_rate = mean(turnout_bin), n = n(), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(turnout_year, aes(x = qes_year_num, y = turnout_rate)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1, color = "#0f4c5c") +   geom_point(size = 2.5, color = "#e36414") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(round(100 * x, 0), "%")) +   labs(     title = "Turnout proxy across study years",     x = "Study year",     y = "Share of respondents"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Analysis: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
code: master <- if (file.exists("qes_master.csv")) {   read.csv("qes_master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) } else {   get_qes_master(assign_global = FALSE, strict = FALSE, quiet = TRUE) }  master <- master %>%   mutate(     qes_year_num = suppressWarnings(as.integer(sub("^([0-9]{4}).*$", "\\1", qes_year))),     vote_choice = tolower(trimws(as.character(vote_choice))),     party_lean = tolower(trimws(as.character(party_lean)))   )

title: Analysis: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
text: classify respondents sovereignty_proxy = 1 party preference mentions party typically associated greater Quebec sovereignty (parti québécois québec solidaire).
code: is_sov_pref <- function(x) {   grepl("parti quebecois|parti québécois|quebec solidaire|québec solidaire", x) }  sov <- master %>%   mutate(     sovereignty_proxy = dplyr::if_else(       is_sov_pref(vote_choice) | is_sov_pref(party_lean),       1,       0,       missing = 0     )   ) %>%   filter(!is.na(qes_year_num)) %>%   group_by(qes_year_num) %>%   summarise(     support_share = mean(sovereignty_proxy, na.rm = TRUE),     n = n(),     .groups = "drop"   ) %>%   arrange(qes_year_num)

title: Analysis: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
text: Sovereignty proxy study year (percent respondents)
code: knitr::kable(   sov %>%     mutate(       support_share = round(100 * support_share, 1)     ) %>%     rename(       year = qes_year_num,       respondents = n,       sovereignty_support_pct = support_share     ),   caption = "Sovereignty proxy by study year (percent of respondents)" )

title: Analysis: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
code: ggplot(sov, aes(x = qes_year_num, y = support_share)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1, color = "#0f4c5c") +   geom_point(size = 2.5, color = "#e36414") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(round(100 * x, 0), "%")) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = sort(unique(sov$qes_year_num))) +   labs(     title = "Evolution of sovereignty proxy across QES studies",     x = "Study year",     y = "Share of respondents"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Analysis: Evolution of Sovereignty Attitudes
text: descriptive proxy based party preference fields. publication-grade causal claims, build study-specific sovereignty item harmonization.

title: Analyse : statistiques descriptives
code: master <- if (file.exists("qes_master.csv")) {   read.csv("qes_master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) } else {   get_qes_master(assign_global = FALSE, strict = FALSE, quiet = TRUE) }  master <- master %>%   mutate(     annee = suppressWarnings(as.integer(sub("^([0-9]{4}).*$", "\\1", qes_year))),     age_group = trimws(as.character(age_group)),     turnout = tolower(trimws(as.character(turnout)))   )

title: Analyse : statistiques descriptives
text: Taille d’échantillon par étude
code: tailles <- master %>%   group_by(qes_year, qes_code, qes_name_en) %>%   summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%   arrange(qes_year, qes_code)  knitr::kable(tailles, caption = "Taille d'échantillon par étude")

title: Analyse : statistiques descriptives
code: age_dist <- master %>%   filter(!is.na(annee), !is.na(age_group), nzchar(age_group)) %>%   group_by(annee, age_group) %>%   summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop_last") %>%   mutate(pct = 100 * n / sum(n)) %>%   ungroup()  ggplot(age_dist, aes(x = annee, y = pct, color = age_group, group = age_group)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 0.9) +   geom_point(size = 1.5) +   labs(     title = "Répartition des groupes d'âge dans le temps",     x = "Année d'étude",     y = "Pourcentage",     color = "Groupe d'âge"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Analyse : statistiques descriptives
text: Proxy de participation par année
code: turnout_annee <- master %>%   filter(!is.na(annee)) %>%   mutate(turnout_bin = case_when(     turnout %in% c("1", "yes", "voted", "certain to vote", "i already voted") ~ 1,     turnout %in% c("0", "2", "no", "did not vote", "certain not to vote") ~ 0,     TRUE ~ NA_real_   )) %>%   filter(!is.na(turnout_bin)) %>%   group_by(annee) %>%   summarise(taux = mean(turnout_bin), n = n(), .groups = "drop")  knitr::kable(   turnout_annee %>% mutate(taux = round(100 * taux, 1)),   col.names = c("Année", "Taux de participation (%)", "N"),   caption = "Proxy de participation par année" )

title: Analyse : évolution des attitudes liées à la souveraineté
code: master <- if (file.exists("qes_master.csv")) {   read.csv("qes_master.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) } else {   get_qes_master(assign_global = FALSE, strict = FALSE, quiet = TRUE) }  master <- master %>%   mutate(     annee = suppressWarnings(as.integer(sub("^([0-9]{4}).*$", "\\1", qes_year))),     vote_choice = tolower(trimws(as.character(vote_choice))),     party_lean = tolower(trimws(as.character(party_lean)))   )

title: Analyse : évolution des attitudes liées à la souveraineté
text: Évolution du proxy d’appui à la souveraineté
code: est_pref_souverainiste <- function(x) {   grepl("parti quebecois|parti québécois|quebec solidaire|québec solidaire", x) }  sov <- master %>%   mutate(     appui_souverainete_proxy = dplyr::if_else(       est_pref_souverainiste(vote_choice) | est_pref_souverainiste(party_lean),       1, 0, missing = 0     )   ) %>%   filter(!is.na(annee)) %>%   group_by(annee) %>%   summarise(taux = mean(appui_souverainete_proxy, na.rm = TRUE), n = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%   arrange(annee) knitr::kable(   sov %>% mutate(taux = round(100 * taux, 1)),   col.names = c("Année", "Part appui souveraineté (%)", "N"),   caption = "Évolution du proxy d'appui à la souveraineté" ) ggplot(sov, aes(x = annee, y = taux)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1, color = "#0f4c5c") +   geom_point(size = 2.5, color = "#e36414") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(round(100 * x, 0), "%")) +   labs(     title = "Évolution du proxy de souveraineté",     x = "Année d'étude",     y = "Part des répondants"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Démarrage avec qesR
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR") library(qesR)

title: Démarrage avec qesR
text: get_qescodes() : liste des codes d’études get_qes("qes2022") : téléchargement d’une étude get_codebook("qes2022") : codebook get_preview("qes2022", 10) : aperçu rapide get_question(obj, variable) : texte de question get_qes_master() : données fusionnées harmonisées

title: Démarrage avec qesR
code: codes <- get_qescodes(detailed = TRUE) qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022") cb <- get_codebook("qes2022") master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE)

title: Démarrage avec qesR
text: Voir aussi : Données fusionnées : fr-donnees-fusionnees Citations : fr-citations-etudes Analyses : fr-analyse-souverainete, fr-analyse-descriptive

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
code: library(qesR)  master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) dim(master) head(master)

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
text: Le fichier fusionné inclut notamment : métadonnées d’étude : qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en champs répondant/entrevue : respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded variables sociodémographiques : year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, education, language, province_territory variables politiques : turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, ideology, political_interest champs additionnels (si disponibles) : citizenship, born_canada, income, religion, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight La fusion applique aussi : une normalisation des valeurs pour rendre les réponses comparables la dérivation de age_group lorsque l’âge ou l’année de naissance est disponible la conservation des répondants panel et non-panel (pas de fusion entre études) le suivi de la provenance via attr(master, "source_map") La déduplication s’applique uniquement à l’intérieur d’un même code d’étude (pas entre enquêtes panel et non-panel).

title: Données fusionnées harmonisées
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR") library(qesR)

title: Getting Started with qesR
text: Core calls: get_qes(srvy) download survey code get_qescodes() list available codes get_preview(srvy, obs) preview observations get_question(data, variable) retrieve survey question text get_codebook(srvy) retrieve codebook get_qes_master() build merged harmonized data

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_qescodes() get_qescodes(detailed = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022") names(qes2022)[1:20]

what: Retrieve the codebook in different layouts
title: Getting Started with qesR
code: cb_compact <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "compact") cb_wide <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "wide") cb_long <- get_codebook("qes2022", layout = "long")

what: Get a preview and question text
title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_preview("qes2022", 10) get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years") get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years", full = TRUE)

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: master <- get_qes_master(   surveys = c("qes2022", "qes2018", "qes2014", "qes2007", "qes1998"),   strict = FALSE )  dim(master) head(master)

title: Getting Started with qesR
text: Surveys loaded labelled form available variable/value labels. Codebook metadata can inspected compact, wide, long layout. Merged data includes harmonized variables, de-duplication, source-map tracing.

title: Getting Started with qesR
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
code: library(qesR)  master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) dim(master) head(master)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
text: merged data includes cross-study fields : study metadata: qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en respondent/interview fields: respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded demographics: year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, education, language, province_territory political variables: turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, ideology, political_interest additional fields available: citizenship, born_canada, income, religion, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight get_qes_master() also keeps merge logic explicit: uses cross-study variable maps value normalization comparability derives age_group age year--birth available retains panel non-panel respondents separate observations stores source-variable provenance attr(master, "source_map") also records source-variable provenance:
code: source_map <- attr(master, "source_map") head(source_map)

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
text: get_qes_master() applies: respondent de-duplication within survey code derived age groups age year--birth available removal rows empty across harmonized variables

title: Merged Dataset Workflow
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thomas Gareau-Paquette. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gareau-Paquette T (2026). qesR: Access Quebec Election Study Datasets. R package version 0.4.4, https://thomasgareau.github.io/qesR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {qesR: Access Quebec Election Study Datasets},   author = {Thomas Gareau-Paquette},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.4.4},   url = {https://thomasgareau.github.io/qesR/}, }

title: qesR
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ThomasGareau/qesR")

title: qesR
text: package provides access QES surveys : get_qes(srvy): download survey code get_qescodes(): list survey codes metadata get_preview(srvy, obs): preview survey get_question(data, variable): retrieve question text get_codebook(srvy): get survey codebook get_qes_master(): build harmonized merged dataset

title: qesR
code: library(qesR)  # list survey call codes get_qescodes()  # load one survey qes2022 <- get_qes("qes2022")  # preview observations get_preview("qes2022", 10)  # retrieve question text get_question(qes2022, "cps_age_in_years", full = TRUE)  # build merged cross-study dataset master <- get_qes_master(strict = FALSE) head(master)

title: qesR
text: downloaded survey files read returned labelled form codebook metadata attached available get_codebook() merged dataset creation includes harmonization, de-duplication, filtering empty rows source-variable provenance available via attr(master, "source_map")

title: qesR
text: qesR includes merged harmonized dataset workflow: harmonizes: study metadata: qes_code, qes_year, qes_name_en respondent/interview info: respondent_id, interview_start, interview_end, interview_recorded demographics: year_of_birth, age, age_group, gender, education, language, province_territory political variables: turnout, vote_choice, vote_choice_text, party_best, party_lean, ideology, political_interest additional fields available: citizenship, born_canada, income, religion, federal_pid, provincial_pid, survey_weight Harmonization applies value normalization, derived age groups, within-study de-duplication, removal rows empty across harmonized variables. See: Merged Dataset
code: get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.csv", strict = FALSE) get_qes_master(save_path = "qes_master.rds", strict = FALSE)

title: Download Codebook Files — download_codebook
text: srvy qesR survey code. dest_dir Directory files downloaded. file Optional file selector passed get_codebook(). quiet TRUE, suppress informational output. refresh TRUE, force fresh codebook metadata download first. overwrite TRUE, overwrite existing files dest_dir.

what: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: Downloads multiple Quebec Election Study datasets, harmonizes shared variables, stacks rows one master data frame, de-duplicates respondents within survey code, drops rows empty across harmonized variables.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
code: get_qes_master(   surveys = NULL,   assign_global = TRUE,   object_name = "qes_master",   quiet = FALSE,   strict = FALSE,   save_path = NULL )

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: surveys Character vector qesR survey codes. Defaults studies get_qescodes(). assign_global TRUE, assign result .GlobalEnv using object_name. object_name Object name used assign_global = TRUE. Defaults "qes_master". quiet TRUE, suppress informational output downloading. strict TRUE, stop study fails. FALSE, return partial results record failures attributes. save_path Optional output path writing master file. Use .rds RDS output; otherwise CSV written.

title: Build a Harmonized Stacked Master QES Dataset — get_qes_master
text: harmonized stacked data frame attributes: source_map, loaded_surveys, failed_surveys, harmonized_variables. Additional attributes duplicates_removed empty_rows_removed report row filtering. save_path provided, output path stored saved_to.

text: Convenience alias get_codebook().

title: Alias for get_codebook — qes_codebook
code: qes_codebook(   srvy,   file = NULL,   assign_global = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   refresh = FALSE,   layout = c("compact", "wide", "long") )

title: Alias for get_codebook — qes_codebook
text: srvy qesR survey code get_qescodes(). file Optional regular expression choosing one file multi-file datasets. assign_global TRUE, assign codebook <srvy>_codebook global environment. quiet TRUE, suppress informational output. refresh TRUE, force fresh download instead using cache. layout One "compact", "wide", "long".

title: Alias for get_codebook — qes_codebook
text: qes_codebook data frame.

title: qesR 0.4.4
text: Added get_qes_master() harmonized merged datasets across QES studies. Added merge quality controls: within-year respondent de-duplication -empty-row removal. Added broader harmonization age, age group, education, turnout, vote choice, weights. Improved codebook workflows compact/wide/long layouts value-label extraction helpers. Added researcher website content merged-dataset documentation, study citations, analysis examples.

title: qesR 0.4.3
text: Added get_question(..., full = TRUE) support richer question-text recovery. Improved codebook metadata parsing handling support files.

title: qesR 0.4.2
text: Expanded QES catalog entries Dataverse file selection behavior.

title: qesR 0.4.1
text: Added get_decon() export updates.

title: qesR 0.4.0
text: Added codebook retrieval formatting helpers.
